repnme.cdata!:
Bulgaria - Second Agriculture Sector
            Adjustment Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The assessment of outcome is
            satisfactory, sustainability likely, though institutional
            development impacts are only modest. Lessons point at the
            need for a strong Government commitment for single tranche
            adjustment, provided such operations are undertaken within a
            well structured medium-term framework. While single tranche
            loans are more flexible, given they preclude legal
            conditions and policy targets (possibly not supported by
            Government), they do depend on continuous monitoring, and
            policy dialogue during implementation. Hence, these
            discussions allow periodic adjustments, and refinement of
            conditions, and facilitates a learning-by-doing process.
            Contrary to the fact that the interest of line ministries in
            adjustment loans is usually weak, due to the political costs
            involved, in this case, the supportive approach of a
            stronger ministry, the Prime Minister's Office,
            contributed to success. And a way to increase line ministry
            support, would be to include technical assistance, and or
            investment components in the adjustment loan. This said, the
            experience with hybrid loans, is evidently poor in Europe
            and Central Asia region. Regarding major policy formulation
            changes, and consensus building, policy-relevant analytical
            work becomes highly valuable for discussing the findings
            with the government, and major stakeholders.

Bulgaria - Second Agriculture Sector
            Adjustment Loan Project

Bulgaria - Second Agriculture
            Sector Adjustment Loan Project

1962147.trustfund:
TF026183-PHRD-AGRICULTURAL SECTOR
            ADJUSTMENT LOAN II PROJECT,TF039775-BULGARIA - ASAL II,TF039673-BULGARIA - ASAL II,TF029304-PHRD-IRRIGATION RESTRUCTURING
            & REHAB. PROJ

repnme.cdata!:
Bulgaria - Second Agriculture Sector
            Adjustment Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Agriculture Sector Adjustment
            Loan Project for Bulgaria aims to support furhter rapid
            development of a more efficient and responsive agricultural
            sector. Reforms will occur in the areas of land markets,
            cereals markets, agriculture eterprise privatization,
            irrigation institutions and legislation, agricultural
            subsidies and finance, trade and regulations, and forest
            policy. The reforms enhance market development and increase
            enterprise competitiveness. This will improve income
            -earning opportunities for rural producers, contribute to
            rural employment generation, and help raise rural living
            standards. Consumers will benefit from improved agricultural
            product quality and availability, greater choice, and more
            efficient marketing channels. The most important risks are,
            first, political resistance by powerful interest groups, and
            second, that the program will be undermined by a
            non-supportive macroeconomic environment.
